title: is there anyone who straight out wins Maokai in top lane?
body: Not raging or complaining, its just that i cant win him at all. unless maybe i go balls mode with Darius and ignite, but even then his tele, sustain and once he gets catalyst forget it. Plus darius sucks ass so yeah.

replies.body:
Hey There,
You are right in saying Maokai because of his sustain and CC is really hard to kill in lane. But I also think he struggles to kill you. 

My advice would be to pick someone that farms well and can scale. From there you either want someone who can teamfight just as well, think rumble or even singed (MR per Level OP), or someone who lategame will be able to outsplit push, maybe Shyvanna or trinity force Fizz. Because Maokai doesnt built damage generally in a push you can kill the wave chip the turret down and stop him from being a huge teamfighting tank.

Let me know if you have any questions, because I think alot of players would struggle with Maokai lanes.

Cheers
Nasus is the correct answer. Rush spirit visage and farm. he becomes useless by 10mins and at 20 minutes you should have 2-3 kills on him because your Q should be at least at 200 by then.
what are you on m8.... by 20 min its ideal to have around 250-350

>at least

Reading comprehension m8.

no, at least should be 250, if your 200 there is something really wrong with your last hitting, and you need to go see someone about that, eye doctor if you cant read their hp, or watch some of those professional videos on how to cs like a non nub

That's why the "at least" is there. Your "at least" seems more like a "you should minimum be hitting this if you're average skill". Whereas mine is literally "if you're playing Nasus, the VERY LEAST you want is 200 at 20 min"

The majority of my games have me sitting at 350-400 around the 20 minute mark with good micro between lane farm and jungle camps/crab.

Go swain or gp
Someone that can poke from far distance and can also give alot of dmg.
Also ryze
I always play gangplank when someone plays Moakai he can't trade vs gp with his poison and crits and stuff just too funny watching..

> [{quoted}](name=SexP3ke,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3JLQxEET,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-07-15T05:07:39.901+0000)
>
> Not raging or complaining, its just that i cant win him at all. unless maybe i go balls mode with Darius and ignite, but even then his tele, sustain and once he gets catalyst forget it. Plus darius sucks ass so yeah.

Fizz is a pretty popular counter to him cuz his raw stats/damage just rek him early on especially if you can get a few ganks top going. The one problem is that top lane fizz isn't as viable come mid-late game teamfights.

I disagree on one point, if Fizz falls behind then indeed he's gonna get wrecked in teamfights but with 40% CDR your E and Q have roughly 4.7 and 3 sec CDs respectively at max rank which makes you really reallllllllly slippery in teamfights.

Fair enough. I totally agree with that. I more meant that maokai's ulimate and cc is pretty crucial in teamfights whereas fizz doesn't really have any (sure there is the knock-up of his ult and the slow on his e). Basically what I am saying is maokai is more team-orientated which can be good and bad in soloq whereas fizz is all about your ability. But yeah fizz just in general is really slippery and I often end up banning him just because I don't wanna have to deal with it.
Cho'Gath is sleeper OP and freelo and needs a nerf, give him a whirl the next time a Maokai tries to ruin your day, also his ult doesn't reduce your ult's damage.
Also going from personal experience on Groot, he has pretty big mana problems if he tries to go super aggressive early and doesnt start with flask.

Well Maokai is one of those brainless champs thats super effective so its kinda difficult to deal with that, as a Rengar main i just all in at level 2 and continue to go all in until i hit level 6, after that i do nothing to him so i just roam and get fed af, thats the most effective way at dealing with him as Rengar and i imagine that works on many other champs as well.
The cc means you can't run away when you get ganked though, which you will often because maokai = easy kills for the jgler.
I know the matchup very well, playing safe goes without saying.

> [{quoted}](name=Unseen Predator,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=3JLQxEET,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-15T07:21:02.000+0000)
>
>i just all in at level 2 and continue to go all in until i hit level 6

I'm going to hit level 2 before the first minion wave dies, a jungler is not going to gank before the first minion wave has died so that is irrelevant, also i will continue to go all in when i know it is ok to do so, like i said playing safe goes without saying.

Is this not common sense? Or are you new?

Ive fought with a couple of maokais as vlad top, i farm early and when i get boots of lucidty + some spellvamp i just Spam Q on him he cant do anything (with my runes + ionian boots + WOTA  i get 40% cd reduction = spam Q)

Kayle, Garen, Nasus are the ones that come up off the top of my head.

Possibly Aatrox though i'm not sure
Irelia can if you don't spam her Q in lane, Shyvana can (spam your combo as he gets his passive fully up and go all in before he uses it.)

im d5 Top main and GNAR just destroys him
build black cleaver first and theres no way you can lose after you get it

thats not a good mentality to have, assuming you're supposed to "win" him. leagues not always about the laning phase anyway. maokai cant do much to you in laning phase unless you duel him (which you shouldnt) use this to your advantage (hint: pick a late game champ)
Nasus, Rumble. Anyone that can still be alive once he has ran out of mana.

This website is quite useful for figuring out stuff like that, players vote on what they think top counters are for certain champs and comment potentially useful advice for counterplay.
" http://www.championselect.net/champions/maokai "

Well i tried maokai the other day for the first time.. Went up against nasus. I didn't have a single clue what to do against him. I didn't deal enough damage to run him out of lane. If i spammed my abilities i'd go oom by the time i could get a kill.. He rushed spirit visage and didnt even poke me, he just kept farming. Come mid game, he was too strong for me to handle and we surredered at 20 because we managed to 3 man gank him and he just killed us all without breaking a sweat. I decided im not gonna use maokai again for a while :s

{{champion:10}}  does pretty well

even if he jumps on you, you can out trade him with your passive and e
TriForce Fizz
